degrees all the month, and seldome <s>either<\s> 
at 3 degrees, nor Calm at any time. 
All <u>April<\u> the Barom<sup>r<\sup> was above 29 inches, 
and under 30. In the beginning of y<sup>e<\sup> Month, 
Snow & Cloudy, w<sup>th<\sup> some Fair, & sharp Frosts, 
till Apr 13, when <u>M<sup>r<\sup> Consett<\u> saith the con-
tinual Winter Frosts were thawed; & that 
on the 15<sup>th<\sup>, they left off their Fires. After 
this, some Cloudy, some Rain, & some 
Fair. The Winds were Variable, com[m]on-
ly 1 & 2 strength, now & then 3, & not 
any day, 0. 
From <u>Apr<\u>. 16, he observed the Ther-
mometer: but by reason I know not its 
Graduation, & had no observations of it in 
the Colder Months, to let me into the know-
ledge of it, therefore I think it of no use 
to take farther notice of it. 
All <u>May<\u> the Range of the Baro-
meter was between 28 & 29 inches; & for 
the most part, above 29c50. This month had
